text: They lied on their billboard they advertised all you can eat crab legs and when we asked for more they said it was only for 1 1/2 lbs. I made sure that I read the billboard when we came in. Another paton was saying the same thing and low and behold when we went outside it had changed. The service was terrkble I had to flag the waitress down several times just to get more butter and drinks. I would never go to a place that practices that kind of deception.
I love hanging out at The Lodge,  the  atmosphere is lovely and their foods and drinks is delicious. .and they have one of the coolest bartender in town,  Crystal is beautiful and  awesome

sorry amber. your service sucked. that's why I stiffed you and told you to your face. just because you have tits does not mean you get a tip . I don't believe in leaving a small tip when service is bad. when you do that servers just call you cheap. i'm a great tipper when I get great service. I  didn't get it from you. I left you nothing because that's what you earned.
We love this location always a great time been coming here for 6 years+ bartenders make it awesome! The gm Amber, Garrett, Amanda and Chevy!
Love this bar. Great service. Mike and Nick are awesome ! 24 hour food. It can get super packed for football games but drinking on the grave shift is my style.  Super chill!!

This bar had to be one of the worst local bars I've been to in a while, bartenders were to busy watching basketball game with 4 customers to ask if wanted anything to drink, then when commercial was on I was graced with their presence, I asked what's on tap, their response was "you want light or dark beer", since they dont have 40 beers on tap think it was more like 6, I believe I was not asking a lot for them to just tell me. Well commercial over game back on, I was motioned for me to look for myself, walked over to taps and picked a beer, 10-20 mins later another commercial and after bartender had a shot with group I was graced again with her presence and finally got a beer. Avoid this place like the plague unless your part of their special group

I go to the Lodge a few nights a week and always enjoy myself. The bar staff is great and the atmosphere is good. Plus there's usually a character or two to talk to. I recommend this place to my friends all the time

The staff is great, pleasant, and polite. I had Mitchell as my Bar Tender and Chevy as my server. Drinks are decent price. Food is excellent and you get nice portions for the cost. Free pool and the other customers don't bother you. Its a very comfortable hang out.

We live down the street and came in for lunch. Gambled plenty of money, bought food and still had to pay for our drinks. AND the bartender told us they just re-calibrated all the machines. No wonder we didn't win. Guess we won't be going there anymore. We could've had a fine dining experience for that price. Instead 2 sandwiches and some beers

My only gripe about this place is that it is so hidden away.  Actually, come to think about it, this is a good thing in a way as it keeps the place not too populated yet have enough people in there to keep it in business.

The decor is excellent (almost reminds me of home in a way with the log-cabin lodge style and outdoors pictures/paintings hanging everywhere.  The moose head on the wall was staring us down while we were enjoying our drinks (I swear!).

The food is served in a separate dining area from the bar and lounge and was quite good for the money.  It was also nice (if you care) to watch sports or something on TV as no matter where you look or sit you have an excellent view of the flat screen LCD televisions.

The bar is a center bar that is surrounded by a large lounge area that is quite nice and comfortable.  I was able to relax, sit back and enjoy a couple beers while entertaining my companion.  There was a fireplace nearby that, if lit, would have given us the lodge feel up on the mountain without the mountain or snow.

If you live on or near Rainbow and are south of the 215, this is an excellent 24-hour restaurant/bar that I would recommend to anyone and will probably be frequenting more often.

Worse service ever. I went there to get spicy chicken fingers. The bartender took 11 minutes and 37 seconds to greet us. I ordered a drink and the bartender took awhile to make a makers on the rocks. I asked when I ordered my drink to order chicken fingers. She told me I had to wait for the server, who never came. Mean while the bartender was on her phone at the POS system. I will never come back here again or any other lodge bar.
Great place for cheap drinks late night food all night and day bartender is attentive and it doesn't get packed come here cheers to that
Friendly staff, nice decor, but really, in the end, it's a typical Nevada style gaming pub. I've nothing bad to say about the place, but nothing really stands out, either.

When we first came into the bar and sat down we were greeted by no one. The girl at the bar was just sitting on the dishwasher talking to another guest, apparently so into conversation that she couldn't greet her guests. After we all have played $50+ dollars we got our tab and only 1 drink was comped each, even though we all had at least 4 drinks. Being a bartender this is 101 to take care of your playing guests. And then the bartender Danny forced us to cash out with him, even though we weren't ready to leave. Bad service!!!!!!
The French onion soup was amazing. That's the only reason I came in. I crave it after having it in Paris. Other items we ordered were great. Nice Irish Mule. They have ginger beer. :)

I stopped in this week for a quick bit to eat. This was my first visit to the Lodge. The service was good - but the food was not. 

I ordered the beef fajitas against my better judgement given I wasn't at a Mexican restaurant, and he ordered some typical bar food. Honestly, I wasn't expecting five star fajitas, but what I got contained large amounts of beefless gristle. Since the lights were dim, it wasn't easy to separate the gristle from beef. It made the fajita experience unfavorable because the fajitas could not be eaten as intended. I ended up picking through the hot plate for what was edible. 

The atmosphere was smoky even in the dining room since service goes through the bar from the dining room adjacent door. The salad was fresh and good. The iced-tea was refreshing.

Went to the Lodge at Shelborne Saturday night for dinner around 7:30.  The bar area was pretty crowded but not a soul in the segregated restaurant area.  After waiting about 15 minutes, the server finally came to take our drink order.  She saw the Entertainment coupon we wanted to use and informed that they no longer accept it.  Asking why, she said it was because of multiple forgeries.  Really???  People actually took the time to forge that little perforated coupon from the Entertainment book?  If that's even close to true, judging from the empty restaurant maybe they should have thanked those people rather than springing their new policy on us.  And if it is true, they couldn't determine that it was a forgery and took appropriate action with the offender(s)?  Whatever, if they're not interested in honoring their commitments, I'm not interested in being their only source of restaurant revenue at the time of that visit.  Adios Shelborne.

went for Superbowl Sunday and had an amazing time, " Brooke " was awesome, very attentive and on point with keeping our drinks filled and food ready,  she was great, definitely coming back to this place , very cozy,friendly and cool place, food was great, drinks were delicious!!! if you come to Vegas check this place out!!!
tell Brooke hello!!!

This is a typical lodge. Nothing special. The area is small, a little dark and  little smoky. The place is not crowded and noisy. It is getting crowded only when the football is on. So, if you are looking for a quiet place to spend time with friends, this place is not bad.  
The bartender makes really great drinks for reasonable prices. The service is slow though. There was only one server and it took a while to place our orders. The food is not the best either. I had a Fajita chicken salad. The chicken was not crispy as I love and it was not well seasoned.  
Satisfactory. I'll give another try.

Cool place log cabin look, fire place played ok music it depends if there is regular in bar meaning older:( you might have to listen too old 70 rock ugh when happy hour 3pm you will get nice looking women bartender but 9pm you will get a old looking perv that doesn't pay attention to customers just his friends so you might be playing the machine no drinks need to change with younger staff.

Full menu even late night? Rockin'.
Driving into town wiped me out, so I took a nap that somehow lasted several hours and missed dinner, so the BF and I headed here for some quality food when finally arose from my slumber.
Despite the late hour, the whole menu was available, and the kitchen was still making orders well- I hate how you can go to a place that claims the whole menu is available, and then they half-ass your order. That was NOT the case at all here- we had an amazing chicken enchilada soup, though it was a little spicy for my preferences; BF got an amazing sandwich/burger (unfortunately neither of us can remember which); and I got one of the grilled chicken salads, with a homemade garlic dressing- the salad itself was huge and filling, but the ingredients and dressing were relatively light, which was appreciated as I'm trying to workout less without gaining weight.
Bartender, as others have said here, was awesome- super friendly, happy to make recommendations, and just overall a good, pleasant guy.
Drink specials were good, though I don't specifically remember what they were and I'm sure they change frequently.
Great off the strip late-night dining option!

This place always provides me with an interesting story to tell the next day. And it seems quite the place to hang if you are a redhead (there are apparently a lot of fans of redheads here). All of which is something that makes me want to give it 4 stars, but I'm holding out until I sample the food (which I have yet to do in all of the times I have been here).

The bartenders have always been friendly and attentive. The clientele are always friendly. Er, well, they're always happy drunk and sometimes a little too friendly. 

But hey, the manager will come introduce himself to you and the bartender will warn you in the bathroom that you should move to the other side of the bar because the drunk guy sitting near you is plotting out a plan to put the moves on you.

Bottom line, always good service and an interesting time. Now if I can just win some money instead of losing it all every time I put in $20 on the video poker machine here.

My friend and I have been looking for a breakfast burrito that will cure the saturday night hangover blues. 
 We ordered one sausage and one bacon burrito, while my lil'one enjoyed the fried mac and cheese. All 3 were comforting, 
but we liked the bacon breakfast burrito the best because of the flavor.  The atmosphere
 is nice and my morning after Modello hit the spot too!

This place is great.  The ambiance is great, the decor is great and the service is always excellent.  They have darts, pool, golden tee, big buck hunter and a few more I think.

The place has a bunch of couches and love seats which are VERY comfortable and I've been tempted to take a nap a few times, and not just because I've been drinking!  I'm glad to have found an awesome bar that's close to my house!

This place used to be my go-to but now it's garbage. Sat for 10 minutes while both bartenders yapped with their buddies on other side of the bar. No comps on drinks while playing on machines?? Seems weird considering Sierra gold, sporting life, hi scores do comps and are only a few minutes away.
I like it here. Very uncommon ambiance. Huge screen for sports. Came here to watch a unlv game. Enjoyed it alot.
Love coming here! The staff is always welcoming and friendly and I've yet to order anything that wasn't any good.

This is a gaming bar for sure The restaurant is nice just depends on what servers that you have there are some that are super friendly and some that should not be working The food is phenomenal I recommend the chicken fried chicken

It seems that we have become regulars without realizing it.  We stopped in for a quick bite a few months ago and were served by Chevy...yes that's her name.  So far we've had both breakfast and Dinners and all meals were good, no complaints.  The bar is separated from the restaurant by a wall with big windows.  I cannot stand the smell of cigarettes, especially when I am eating and thankfully it is not smelled on this side. However you must go through the bar to get to the restrooms so count on your hair smelling like smoke when you return. The food is great, Wednesday evenings are snow crab night for 14.99, Thursdays are 1/2 cost entree. The wait staff are all very polite and on the ball. No waiting to be served or refilled...Great service.

Didn't eat just had drinks.  Gene the bartender is a fabulous dude.  Super friendly, attentive and nice.  It's dark and kind of tavern-y which I liked.  The bar was busy for a Wednesday night.  Big loggy furniture which looked comfy - but we sat at the bar.  I hear the food is good but....again, we didn't eat.  There are pool tables in the back.  Diverse crowd from 9 to 5ers to bikers to 20 somethings.  It's a snuggly feeling for a bar only thing I didn't like is it's super smokey but hey, it's a bar right?  Next time I'll try the food.

Friendly bartenders and waitresses.
Chevy is our favorite! Super sweet and loves to give hugs! Lol
Bomb chicken wings! I love their chicken wings! And their salads are pretty yummy too! Always fresh and always yummy! 
Cute little bar with gaming and they even have a closed up dining area so if you want to bring your kids that works too!

Food is only half decent IF you can even get service. And IF you do get service, you're lucky if the waiter knows the food or bar menu. Bar area was extra smoky during regular hours. I don't mind smoky places but ventilation systems are key - and in our situation, lacking. (Summary, Our waiter sucked)

Only because we have to give them at least one star. The bartender is a huge asshole, really bad, cocky attitude. Apparently the only noise HE wants to listen to is ghetto rap crap. When paying customers tried to change their music in the jukebox, he turned the volume down because he didn't like it. Not to mention he spent 20 minutes sitting his man bun ass ON THE bar talking trash with some young women (I am being generous). I live in the neighborhood and expect better from a bartender.

I must be missing something here as I can't believe have many good reviews there are for this place.  Maybe we hit it on a bad day, but our experience was not good.

Went in for lunch and ordered hamburgers medium rare.  Well, all three orders of burgers came out medium well, very dry and tasteless.  I have to say I think this is the worst burger I have had since I've been in Vegas (10 years).  A burger from Wendy's would have been a better burger.  Our three year old refused to eat it and she loves burgers . . . .just ate the cheese off her burgers that was an extra charge on a kids plate.

The drink are sort of expensive too.  $7.25 for a beer at a non strip establishment.   Come on . . . you must be kidding.

I did like the look of the place though . . .that's the only reason this place got two stars.  5 stars for concept and negative stars for food.

Service was just average as well.

Awful service. Used to enjoy coming here, will not return. I have had bad service before, and if servers make mistakes  and apologize or admit them, I can have sympathy. The server ignored us most of the night, and would not apologize or acknowledge his mistakes. Unhappy with how our experience ended up here and we will not return.

We are never coming back to this place due to the horrible service. The blue hair bartender completely ignored us for 10 minutes yet walked up to the booth right behind us. 

Here is a tip management get rid of people who lose you business because we will never come back to this place. 

Go to the Distillery, great service and food.

I live in the area and thus have been longing to go to the Lodge.  Matter-of-fact, I have been pestering the girlfriend to go there (ever since I got my new home).  That is three years of pestering.

Well, lets say that I am very disappointed.  First of all, there is NO HAPPY HOUR FOR FOOD.  ONLY DRINKS.  NO 1/2 APPETIZERS!  The food was some of the worse I have ever had.  The fish & chips tasted like dish soap.  How do fish & chips taste like dish soap???  The girlfriend ordered the salmon and it was tasteless (at least it didn't taste like soap!). 

Oh yeah, bad service and fairly expensive.

Well, I shall not be going back and the girlfriend is laughing at me about the whole thing.
I love this place, my family and I usually come on Sundays for breakfast and Chevy is always usually our server, she is the best, one of the reasons we keep returning here.

Out of all the lodges I've been to this is probably the best from food wise to service wise. I like their pool tables as well. Service is quick and attentive. Order the nachos and chicken wings both were good! And the waitress came by a lot to make sure our drinks were filled.

Had reservations for brunch at The Sparklings next door but got there early so wandered into The Lodge for curiosity and fell in love!!! It's a local hangout that's feels like a warp into time a la Aspen circa 79. It was awesome (keep in mind we were hungover and starving in the desert) but felt right at home pretending to be locals at 1030am. The mimosas were legit the best I've ever had...served in a big wine glass not a champagne glass! Plus, the champs was a heavy pour with just a kiss of OJ! Fits the bill for me and my crew at 1030am. The bartender was so sweet and attentive! The bathrooms were surprisingly awesome and they have an old school cigarette machine too (I quit smoking but this made me want to start again because it was so swanky). I loved this place and can't wait to go back!

Almost couldn't find this listing since "Shelbourne" is misspelled. 

I've been to most of the Lodge restaurants/bars in the area, and this one is my favorite. I visit the restaurant portion only, not the bar, and this Lodge has a good separation between the smoking (bar) and non-smoking (restaurant) areas. The food is very good - not spectacular but a notch above what you often find at comparable places. And the service here is typically a little better here than at other Lodges. If you live in the southwestern part of the valley, this is a good option for a casual meal.

I'm not a risktaker by any means.  I have three or four standard menu items that I order every single time from whichever place that I go to.  That's the extent of mixing it up, in my book.  My best friend, however, is different.  She likes to order new and odd things, try it, usually hates it and then I split half of my meal with her because she also refuses to return food for something better.

We both stumbled onto this place after an hour of indecision regarding where we would grab dinner.  Straightaway, I was impressed that there was a bar area and a separate glassed off section to keep the restaurant customers away from the musky smoke smell.

Our waitress then came to take our order and I got a buffalo chicken wrap (as usual) and my friend got the steak sandwich.  She loved it and I got to eat my meal (which was amazing) in it's entirety.  After that, we split a small dessert, which came out HUGE.

Right about the time that we had both finished eating, we hear the waitress inform another party that since it was Wednesday that all food was 50% off for a promotion they were running.  EXCUSE ME?!

So, we got great service, great food and only paid $16.00 for two meals and a dessert.  I was incredibly impressed by that.  Additionally, it's so close to my house that I intend to be a regular fixture at this place!
Great happy hour food and drinks!! love the prime rib!! Cozy cabin atmosphere makes you feel like you're not in vegas!

My husband and I go out on Friday nights, and usually prefer places with pool tables so we can shoot for a few hours, eat, and play the machines for a bit. 

The service is so-so, and sadly, that's the best thing I can say about the place.

 If you are not sitting at the bar, the waitress makes you close out your tabs at the end of her shift, whether you're finished or not. You have to open a new one with the next shift if you wish to continue. 

If you order food from the bar side, you will have to contend with two tabs, as your food and beverages cannot be combined onto one bill.

The music is old and smarmy. You should never play bad music loudly, but on weekend nights, they do.

The food is mediocre and overpriced.

It is generally about nine thousand degrees in the pool table area.

Most importantly, if you are a GAMER, skip this place altogether. They DO NOT cater to gamers. There are probably 18 machines around the bar, and on Friday and Saturday nights, they are all occupied. Unfortunately, I literally walked around the bar the last two Fridays we were there and counted the actual players. Every machine was full, yet only FIVE people had money in the machines. They sit and chat with friends, text, play games on their phones and watch TV, all of which could be done in one of the very comfortable seating areas if the bartenders were interested in actually making some tip money.

Also, they do not comp meals, no matter how much you spend.

Sorry Lodge. We have too many other options in this town to put up with you.

Food is typical bar food. However, the service is atrocious! My husband and I finished our drinks just as the entrees were delivered to our table. The drinks weren't refilled once while we were eating, and we could not get the waitress' attention. In addition, we had to ask for silverware, and didn't receive it until after the appetizer arrived. Again, food is just okay, but I will not be back due to the lack of service.

This used to be one of my favorite bars to frequent when I lived in Las Vegas. The decor is like a mountain lodge and reminds me of something that would be at a ski resort. The lighting is dim and perfect, and there are a ton of large flat screen high def. TVs for all you sports fans. 

One word sums up the Lodge...COZY. From the comfy and plentiful seating, the fireplaces, the decor, the dim lighting, and the comfort food on the menu. I went to the one on Ft. Apache, but it wasn't as cozy as this one. The Lodge at Shelborne makes me want to kick my feet up, snuggle up next to someone and stay awhile!

Went in tonight to check out the prime rib special and was not disappointed! Came with 2 big sides and soup or salad for just $11. Our server Hunter was amazing! Great atmosphere for kicking back and the decor makes you feel like you're in a cozy cabin in the middle of the woods. Will definitely be returning soon!

I think this place has potential!!!
Has a great look to it, fun and helpful stuff...but the fact that they allowed smoking inside lets me cold...I was there for the Oscar night with my husband, it wasn't the reason why we stop there, we were just looking for a place to enjoy a drink or two, but the channel we were watching was cut off for about 10 minutes. That was disappointing, especially when the cigaret smoke wouldn't stop coming towards us...

Great for a late night steak and eggs. The menu is pretty diverse so you can find whatever you want no matter who you are. The dining room is enclosed so that people can smoke at the bar which is nice. Great service all around. Been going here for 8 years and have never been disappointed. I would recommend putting a menu online though for us "take out'ers" though.

There's so many good 24 hour bar/food/gaming joints in town and I have several favorites. 
I love the late shift folks here so much.  Even though it's sort-of-not-really out of my way to go from the gym to here, this has become my regular late night spot due to the good service from Mike, Brooke, Nick, and Megan.  The kicker was the best kept secret they have, their evening chef, Ricardo.   The other evening chefs, Austin and Timo, great too (don't know his name) but I am usually there when Ricardo is on the clock.  

This location is always clean, fairly busy for late evening, and the food is just crazy good here.  I am a huge bacon and egss fan and the bacon might possibly be the most perfectly cooked bacon I've ever had in my life.  I order this almost every time I'm there and it consistently stellar.  I've also had the salmon and it was fantastically fresh and cooked exactly as I requested.  They don't balk at any of my dietary needs. The service is super friendly and efficient.  I felt like a true regular within 2 visits.  Mike is engaging and friendly; Brooke has some supernatural way of anticipating your needs and is just so personable.  I've quickly turned into a regular here.
Love this place. So glad it's 30 seconds from my house too. But the atmosphere, the food, the pool is all good. You won't be disappointed.

This is a very relaxing restaurant with good food and friendly service. Occasionally my guy and I meet friends there at the bar to have a few drinks. It is not loud or smokey so you can enjoy friends and talk and enjoy our evening!

I love this place.. I don't know all the staff, but Steve and Monica are awesome.  You can't help but feel comfortable there.  Some bars only cater to their "regulars" but these folks are super friendly to everyone.  I will definitely be back.  Oh yeah, the food was good too!
Never been to a bar/restaurant that makes me feel like home until I came here. Amber, Brooke, Chevy, Nick, Andy, Mike when he was there, and I think his name is Buddy or Guy, they're friggin awesome!

BROOKE is my all time favorite server!!! I swear, you NEVER have to go out of your way to ask her for anything, she has superpowers that automatically knows what drinks you want! I've only been there a few times and she memorized mine and my gf's order! She's super friendly and she makes The Lodge the best bar to be. They have three pool tables, multiple lounge areas, and it's a sweet and cozy bar just to hang out. I highly recommend The Lodge on Shelbourne. Their drinks & food are all good. Prices are fair as well. Hope & pray you have BROOKE as your server and you won't be disappointed. Don't forget to tip her nicely, she deserves it!!!! Brooke, you are AWESOME. She deserves a raise, most definitely. She's the reason why my family and I officially made The Lodge our go-to spot!! You the bomb, girl! PS the BEST bartender ever, is AMANDA. That girl can make drinks!!!!!! Better tip her good too! They are the BEST!!!!!!!!!! Go BROOKE & AMANDA!!!! Another waitress worth mentioning is CHEVY!!!! She is an amazing server, super friendly, and on top of her game!!! Every time I see a burger or drink in her hand coming towards our section, she brings us a bunch of joy and laughter!

Been going here a few times since it is near home. I drink, gamble and eat. As for drink its standard. For food its hit and miss. Sometimes its amazing and sometimes its just horrible. As for gambling... I have been warned by others about gaming at a "Lodge Bar". Now I see why... put hundreds in each night I wemr there with not even a minor win. Really tight Machines. Gamblers be warned.

Looking for Chris Clay??? He's down the street at HOOTERS as of 3-15
You're welcome.

A good place to watch a game and/or hang out with a friend & have a few drinks - especially on a cold night with the fireplace going..  The chairs were comfy, the potato skins were delicious, and the beer was cold and quite affordable.  The waitress was friendly and attentive, too.  Where the lodge loses points is in the murky atmosphere.   I've been in many bars where smoking was allowed, but I rarely left stinking of cigarette smoke, as I did here.  Whatever quirk of ventilation is responsible, I'd love to see them address it, as this is a deal-breaker.

Typical lodge. Gambling, drinks, food, tv with sports. I guess I can say its typical and just a place to go with frienss to hang out. Its a local bar so its nice to go where its close to home. Nothing really to brag about. I have had a few friends work here as bartenders so it was nice to go when they were working. Always nice to go where people know you. If i have friends in town or if someone wants to know of a place thats just relaxing I will recommend here.
Chris the bartender on grave is the best, new menu has some pretty decent bar food.  Great drinks, great service, a great place just to hang out and chill.

A year ago I would have given this place one star, but they have definitely turned the place around lately. Food is better, service is good. Not sure if they changed ownership or what, but whatever it was, they made some huge improvements there.

Local bar, but not that PT kind of local. The Lodge is a hidden gem. Walk in and you instantly feel like you're at a ski lodge up in the mountains, not across the street from Walmart in the desert. It has a cozy feel and the bartenders make you feel at home. Rockers, couches, etc all have you feeling comfy. They have multiple pool tables and darts. This is the perfect place to come for a drink when you're not looking to get dressed up for the strip or want to avoid all the other locals at a PTs.
Good food. Good staff. I go to the lodge quite often and like the company that Amber and Crystal and Chevy provide. It's a plus that the foods good in a place I don't expect it to be

Way to ruin a good experience with bad service!

I've always been intrigued by the type of establishment that The Lodge taverns are: a little more than your average pub, with some effort put into interior decorating and set up.  Upon entry, The Lodge at Shelbourne showed promise: nicely laid out, not too crowded, not too smokey.  The menu offered more options that I expected...  

That's where it all fell apart -- ordering food was a mistake.  Not that the food was bad.  The food was great.  It just felt like a completely different -- and understaffed -- organization was serving the food.  There was only one food server on the floor, and two lackadaisical bartenders didn't want anything to do with anybody who ordered food.

Of course, it's not every day that you see a group of eight ladies, who decide to split one check.  And we are not talking about one check split equally among eight people.  We are talking about everybody getting a separate check for exactly what they ordered.  The lone server was sweating by the time she was done splitting the check, running eight credit cards, and "packaging" eight slips in eights holders.  I honestly had never seen anything like that -- and it did take some time!

During the whole ordeal, my wife and I just sat there and waited for our turn to get our check (no intention of splitting anything -- we eat out as a team).  By the time the wait approached 20 minutes, I started doing work: cleaned up and organized our plates, consolidated trash.  Then I ran out of patience and told one of the lackadaisical bartenders that he really shouldn't be just chilling behind the bar.  I got a moderately unfriendly look back and a comment: "I transferred your drinks to your food check."  That I already knew.

It's hard for me to know exactly why what happened happened.  Perhaps, they really have two different companies under one roof -- but that's unlikely.  Perhaps, food servers and bartenders don't share tips -- okay, makes sense.  In the end, however, I should not be guessing.  My only concern is that the service was awful, and I will not be back to any of The Lodges in Las Vegas for a while...

Went there today for lunch and had a burger. It was pretty good but I asked for a side of mayo since it didn't come on the sandwich and was charged .50 cents for it. I hate when places nickel and dime you like this so i'll never go back because of the principle. Most burgers come with Mayo, how any restaurant could charge you for it is beyond me. That's like ordering soup and being charged for the crackers. FAIL.

I was just here this past weekend and I ordered a cup of water. While I was drinking the water  from a straw I felt something hard come up through the straw and felt it in my mouth. I took it out and it was a clipped finger nail! Disgusting!! And they did nothing to compensate for what I had to experience! I will not be going back! Completely disgusting and embarrassing! I still want to puke just thinking about it. If I could I would post this with 0 stars!!

Came in w/ a friend for breakfast and a Bloody Mary.... Probably one of the worst bloodies I've ever had... It was completely void of any flavor other than bland tomato juice. Do yourself a favor and go elsewhere unless you like spending $6 for sadness in a glass.

Went in on a weeknight with a friend from out of town. I immediately loved the warm feeling of the cozy lodge. We ordered, artichoke dip, potato skins, a patty melt and nachos. The food was good. I was hoping the nachos had some more cheese and when Brooke asked and I told her, she immediately took off the nachos with a sincere apology. We had dirty martinis, titos mules, and Long Island iced teas. Just a wonderful evening in a cozy environment with great friends, great service, and good food.

So many other options. Don't choose this place unless the apocalypse leaves it as the only place left. Only gambled $100 but still charged for both my drinks, remade my gf's drink after making it wrong and still charged us for both. Bartender was attentive to her sister and their friends but the rest of us in the bar were ignored. I know it was her sister because she kept apologizing for how loud they were. Do yourself a favor and skip this place. Bad service, no gambling comps, and crap food
This place is a wonderfull place to go to... inexpensive and very friendly bartenders and some sexy ones at that... woo hoo!!! Love the screens in there and the food is excellent!!!

We have been here a few times and sat in the bar area. We also get take out food from here a lot. 

1. The food is very good. They have delicious salads and they are huge! We also like the wings from here. We usually  do take out and the girls who work on the restaurant side are friendly and fast..... 

2. The place itself is only ok. Super dark (like your usual Vegas tavern). The bar staff is nice and friendly but only if you order drinks. Don't expect them to pay attention to you if you just want a soda or water. The bar side is really smokey and it filters in to the restaurant side, which is supposed to be "smoke free". The whole place reeks of smoke though. 

3. Fun/entertainment is kind of lacking. It's nice and big so if you bring a lot of people it's pretty cool because you have tons of space. They have poker machines, pool tables and golden tee. They don't have a juke box and the music they play kind of sucks. They don't have a lot of live entertainment or kareoke or anything. 

I give them three stars because the food is good and fast. Other than that, I'd never go there.

Wow! It has been awhile since I have been at a restaurant and been blown away by the service we received. 

I can say today we were!! We walked in and were they only ones here at first and slowly people trickled in. An employee that was leaving said I am leaving but here are your menus and we will be right with you. 

Brooke was our server and was the highlight of our night. She went above and beyond for and was 100% amazing. 

Our food arrived promptly and was good eats! We ordered the prime rib special and was good for the price. 

Good place to eat! Good service!

5-14-2015 - We went again tonight.  There were 2 people there (drinking beer and watching basketball).  We were sitting for a very long while before we started a clock watch on the experience. So, actually more then 15 minutes passed and no one noticed us.  The bar seemed to be hopping (crowded).  So, a long time went by and no one asked us if wanted water, drinks, napkins, handed menus to us or anything else.  It was a long time past 15 minutes of waiting.  We were both hungry  I asked my husband if we should go into the bar to say hello or something to let them know we were here.  My husband said it was not necessary.  So, we left.  It is sad but what were we supposed to do ?  We were upset - no one noticed that we left.  


5-2-2015 - My husband and I went here on the night of the Pacquiao vs. Mayweather fight, which took place on 5-2-1015.  Our service was horrible, and when we mentioned it to the server he said (and this is a direct quote).  "Yes everyone is complaining tonight - I just don't know what it is".  This was a server we had never seen before (we usually get served by a favorite server and she was not there that night). I ordered the salmon with a honey glaze sauce, and it game out with a different sauce.  I ordered the nachos - it was very very dry, hardly any cheese, just horrible - just disgusting.  It tasted and looked as if someone put something on a plate and shoved it in the microwave oven.  It was barely warm, and the shredded cheese was not melted yet - just basically sitting there as a layer within the nachos and meat.  The meat was too spicy, and barely visible.  There was one teaspoon of sour cream (on the top of the nachos) and we mentioned it to the server - he said NOTHING.  There was nothing on the side (like any other type of sauce) which was just sad because it was so dry.  I ordered the tomato soup which is my favorite, and it came out great (like usual).  My ice tea was horrible (it is usually great), and I had to order soda (which I hate).  Every time I mentioned this to the server, he just clicked his teeth and repeated "yes, everyone is complaining tonight - I just don't know what it is".  He gave us the bill without asking us if we wanted desert (we always get desert at The Lodge because usually it is really good).  He took the bill back when we mentioned we wanted a desert (and he seemed to be upset that we were ordering a desert).  Anyway, he never sent the manager over (I had a feeling no manager was on duty).  I heard other patrons complain about their meals regarding various issues they had (so we weren't the only ones getting horrible food and service).  Later on, I heard him talking and laughing with co-workers and patrons regarding the fight, which seemed to be on the minds of everyone.  Instead of anyone offering us ANYTHING to make up for this fiasco, we received the bill (which we paid in full and we tipped generously, like we normally do).  Generally, when I go to The Lodge (and there are several that we go to on a pretty regular basis) the food and service are excellent. It was horrible on this night and we have not been back to a Lodge facility since then (and we do eat out at least 4 - 5 nights a week because we have illness in our family and are always in a hospital or something else).  Going out to eat is something special for us because we use that time to touch base and share loving thoughts and stay away from medical talk.  I would rate this place at "0" stars, but it would not let me.  I had to pick 1 star.  So, unless we really talk ourselves into going there again (like another location), we probably won't.  It was too disappointing.

Another lodge in Vegas usually means the same menu and the same experience.  At least you know what you're getting in, in this case we got a little more though.

We stopped by to catch part of the World Series, which meant it was dinner time!   

Dinner entrees are available from 4 pm to 11 pm daily and served with dinner salad.  (I always appreciate that their dinner salads are generous, not like those itty bitty side salads you get from fast food restaurants.)  

I chose the Cajun Penne Pasta "Cajun seasoned chicken, andouille sausage, bell peppers tossed in a creamy white sauce with penne pasta.  Topped with fresh grated parmesan and sliced green onions.  Served with garlic bread." ($11.95) - When that giant platter arrived, I was shocked!  It was beyond a generous portion!  And it was a tasty pasta dish with chunks of sausage and chicken mixed in.  Definitely something that you need to share.  It's a lot of food!

The Husband got the Beer Batter Fish-N-Chips "Alaskan Cod Filet, beer battered and fried to a golden crispy.  Served with fries and cole slaw."  ($11.95) - As we started into the fish, he noticed that it was previously frozen.  But what we didn't realize was that the two pieces of cod were stuck together.  When we separated them, we realized they were still frozen!  Yikes!  I waved the waitress down and showed her the fish.  She apologized and took it away immediately.  A new order came out later on, with a new piece of fish and the previous one refried.  

When the bill arrived, the fish and chips were automatically taken off without us saying anything.  

Although there is a separate dining area from the bar, there's not much that keeps the smoke from entering the eating area.  Something to consider if this bothers you.

They also offer 39 cent wings on Tuesdays and Wednesdays form noon to midnight!

Walked in, had a seat in the dining area... Waited ten minutes for even an acknowledgement from the staff... Nothing. Not even a hello. Walked out, took our business elsewhere. #NoServiceIsWorseThanBadService

We come here once a week or so.  This place is great.  The customer service, food, drinks and gaming are top notch.  We especially love coming here on Wednesday for the $11.99 Prime Rib special.  This is some of the best in town.  The other food on the menu is great too.  Burgers, biscuits and gravy and the salads are all awesome.  (Update review). We are here for the Super Bowl party.  They did a great job of getting prepared and awesome giveaways.  Got to do a "shout out" to Chevy, Amber, Amanda and Brooke.  They are a great bunch of employees here!!

....and I WON the 55" tv at the SB51 party

This review is solely for the lack of service and hospitality received by a day shift bartender who I'm told is part time by the name of Rebecca/ Becky. We frequent this bar mostly for peter the grave bartender and the food has always been good. But our first experience with this specific person  was completely cold and rude to us, knowing we were there celebrating a birthday it had been a long night for us but giving we all work in the industry we were very much respectful and definitely not causing issues, birthday girl had had a few too many and had her head rested on the bar as we packed up our food togo and paid our tab well apparently Becky wasn't having it. What was most upsetting is we were the only ones in the bar we are repeat costumers and always spend some money her approach was wrong and honestly felt 
stereotyped. We will not return as long as she is serving, sadly disappointed we will make sure to be out as soon as our friend on grave finishes his shirt.

Good american diner fare.  I will be coming back.  The bar is full of smoking 9 to 5ers so that is a little odd to people watch while eating... There are glass windows so diners can watch the bar like caged animals at the zoo.  The posturing of the males, the attempted mating overtures, the awkward maneuverings of friend alliances.  I swear it is like taking a primatology course mixed with dinner theatre.  Very worth it.  The food is even good and you are served large portions I had enough for lunch the next day as well.

Well this place used to be cool, but now I guess they are under new management that makes it totally uncool.  Tried to go there and watch College Football last Saturday & they wouldn't turn the sound on.  There were 7 people in the whole place, counting the 3 in my party.  And all we wanted was the 1 TV to have sound.  They only do sound on Sundays (Can you say that's the stupidest thing ever?)  Lost me as a customer for good.

This happened to be another stop in the qualifying rounds for the wing bowl and when I walked into this place it made me feel like I walked into a backwoods hunting lodge crossed with a strip club... I know that is an extremely odd way to start a review or to even describe any place you would invision but it is true. Let me try and explain. 

Walking into the front door you are faced with a decision, Go left and end up in the restaruant for "family dining" or go right and end up in the bar.... Of course I went right, that is where the contest was being held. as you walk in to the smoke filled room you start seeing the large antler light fixtures as well as heavy river rock design with tables that look like something out of the bernstein bears, made with large logs and all outdoors items. But you walk by the bar and the bartenders are runing back and forth due to being busy and you see 3 dudes in polo shirts which was normal in my mind for a bar like this.... That was all until the one female bartender rounded the corner... We all had to double take, dress slacks and the smallest bikini top I have ever seen. Now, dont get me wrong I guess in a sence I am not complaining but than again it was almost too much. 

The place would be a great place to take a group of  buddies to go grab some drinks and play some pool or something but to take your  lady to grab a drink and sit at the bar and play some video poker...Maybe not, I watched as multiple couples came and went as you could tell that they were not expecting that. The place is okay as far as I am concerened, I dont know that I would ever go out of my way to go there but t is not a complete dump either. Go check it out for yourself and see what you think.

Not only is the quality of the food above most pubs here... but then there is BROOKE! She is an awesome waitress , but more! My husband and I go in every Wednesday nite about 9:30 pm... we actually consider her so much more than " our server"... she is a special woman... who we love to spend an hour and a half every week! Her laughter will make u smile the minute u walk in. Thank you Brooke! Carey & liz!!

This used to be my spot to hang out since it was close to my house. Once my fave bartender left this spot went to crap. Last time I stopped in I dropped a hundo in the machine and got my ass handed to me. When I closed out the bartender brought me my entire tab. He said he could only comp drinks while I was gaming. Thanks and see ya never again!

Came here for breakfast. We ordered the chicken fried chicken and chicken fried steak. Both were very good. The chicken was tender and the sausage gravy was tasty. The coffee was good as well. My husband and I had the dining room to ourselves. The only reason The Lodge didn't get 5 stars is because of the service. The girls were very friendly and willing to get what we needed but they were also servicing the bar. So trying to get their attention was a bit difficult. Just ask for whatever you need as soon as you get your food.

It's local, it's not packed, and it's laid back. I think it's a bit TOO laid back, but if your'e looking for a quiet time to catch up with friends this place ain't too bad. 

Shockingly, the onion rings were SO GOOD. I really loved it. And it was unexpected. 
The bartender makes some really great drinks. And the prices for drinks are very reasonable. 

If it wasn't for the onion rings and cool bartender, I wouldn't be giving it a 3 star.

.50$ for Honey mustard on the side. 

I've been stopping in here occasionally for the past year and over  the last several months something has changed. 

I don't know if they have new owners or a new "bean-counter" but everything; from the prices of the draft beer, to the happy hour specials, to the notifications of 1 drink per $20.00 in the machine, to a side of fries that number a dozen fries or less is set up to squeeze every last cent they can from you.  

Not to mention .50$ for a side of honey mustard for said fries.

That I wasn't told was an added charge til I got my bill.  I mean who charges for that? Seriously? What owner thought that that is a GOOD IDEA? 

There are too many places (Rounders, PTs, Sporting life  name a few) in the vicinity that actually CATER to locals and not try to turn them upside-down and shake them for every dollar possible. 

This time was my LAST time. 

This is the kind of review that I wish I would have read before setting foot in this place like this. 

NOTE: Any business person that is thinking about opening an establishment of this nature should take note and visit, at least once, the Lodge at Shelborne. Because they are running a MASTER-CLASS in how to alienate customers and drive people away. 

You have been warned.

Great happy hour specials but with discounted on food comes mediocre flavor. Chicken wings were decent but nachos I'd never order again. However, the girls that were working durning lunch time were very nice and made sure to check back with our group frequently with was awesome.

This was a rare occasion where I have had to walk out of an establishment I was seated to have dinner at without eating. This was on St. Patrick's day night in which as tradition I took my Mom out for corned beef and cabbage. We decided to visit this location as they were serving a corned beef and cabbage dinner.

Long story shorty our corned beef and cabbage dinners come out and the beef is tough and overcooked as can be. We both took a bite of our meal and it was impossible to attempt to eat it was so bad.

So we inform the server and showed her that not even the knife would cut through it.
She says oh no but we have been serving it all night! I am thinking in my head, really lady well I am looking at two shoe insoles on my plate right now. The server then states well why don't I have the Chef come out and explain the meal to you?

WTF, what is to explain, what is in front of me is inedible. I don't care what kind of story he tells me about it I am not eating it! Final Answer and I find it hard to believe that others had not complained about it or sent it back. So she finally takes the plates away and we left as agreed without paying. We drove over here from across town special for this meal and I resent being put in that position to have to leave over something like this. Not Cool!

Never again, crossing The Lodge off of my list which is too bad because the location we ate at seven years ago on Ft. Apache had an Amazing corned beef and cabbage dinner. We called them this year and were informed they were not participating so that is how we ended up at this location.

Met up a newbie Vegas-person on the other side of town for a few drinks and what not. quaint lodge that has pool tables, dart machine, slots, a huge Moose head. Bartender was sweet and made a drink to my liking. I had no idea what it was, but it was nice and sweet.

I dont know what happened to this place. I used to come here all the time with friends and family and always remember great food, great sports channels, and great service. Came in here to have a quick lunch and had the French dip sandwich. Meat was dry and bland, no flavor. Au jus sauce was lukewarm and the roll wasn't even toasted.. The ice tea was watered down and they seemed to be limited on their sports channels... It's baseball season there needs to be games on and they didn't have any baseball channels??! I'm giving it 2 stars cause at least the server was friendly and checked on us once or twice and because the dining area and bar are separated (no smoking dining). I used to enjoy this place and now I don't think I'll return.
